facts.location: Intersection of Colonial Drive and Orange Avenue, Orlando, FL
facts.event: Officer Smith conducted a traffic stop of Mr. Davis for an alleged broken taillight. Upon approaching the vehicle, Officer Smith immediately drew his weapon and ordered Mr. Davis out of the vehicle without any indication of threat or non-compliance.

While Mr. Davis was complying with commands and exiting the vehicle with his hands raised, Officer Smith grabbed Mr. Davis by the arm and threw him to the ground face-first. Officer Smith then placed his knee on Mr. Davis's back and neck for approximately three minutes while handcuffing him, despite Mr. Davis's repeated statements that he could not breathe.
facts.harm: Broken nose, facial lacerations, contusions to back and ribs, anxiety, PTSD symptoms

facts.event: Mr. Davis was arrested and charged with resisting arrest without violence. All charges were subsequently dropped by the State Attorney's Office on 2025-07-01.
facts.harm: False arrest, detention for 18 hours, reputational harm

facts.event: Officer Smith has been the subject of twelve prior complaints alleging excessive force, none of which resulted in disciplinary action. The Orlando Police Department has a pattern and practice of failing to investigate or discipline officers for excessive force complaints, and the department's use of force training has been criticized as inadequate by independent consultants.

non_monetary_goals: Policy reform on use of force
